00072 /* Reading and writing of an in-memory TIFF file. */
00073 static tsize_t imb_tiff_ReadProc(thandle_t handle, tdata_t data, tsize_t n);
00074 static tsize_t imb_tiff_WriteProc(thandle_t handle, tdata_t data, tsize_t n);
00075 static toff_t  imb_tiff_SeekProc(thandle_t handle, toff_t ofs, int whence);
00076 static int     imb_tiff_CloseProc(thandle_t handle);
00077 static toff_t  imb_tiff_SizeProc(thandle_t handle);
00078 static int     imb_tiff_DummyMapProc(thandle_t fd, tdata_t* pbase, toff_t* psize);

00082 /* Structure for in-memory TIFF file. */
00083 typedef struct ImbTIFFMemFile {
00084     unsigned char *mem; /* Location of first byte of TIFF file. */
00085     toff_t offset;      /* Current offset within the file.      */
00086     tsize_t size;       /* Size of the TIFF file.               */
00087 } ImbTIFFMemFile;
00088 #define IMB_TIFF_GET_MEMFILE(x) ((ImbTIFFMemFile*)(x))

00112 
00123 static tsize_t imb_tiff_ReadProc(thandle_t handle, tdata_t data, tsize_t n)
00124 {
00125     tsize_t nRemaining, nCopy;
00126     ImbTIFFMemFile* mfile;
00127     void *srcAddr;
00128 
00129     /* get the pointer to the in-memory file */
00130     mfile = IMB_TIFF_GET_MEMFILE(handle);
00131     if (!mfile || !mfile->mem) {
00132         fprintf(stderr, "imb_tiff_ReadProc: !mfile || !mfile->mem!\n");
00133         return 0;
00134     }
00135 
00136     /* find the actual number of bytes to read (copy) */
00137     nCopy = n;
00138     if ((tsize_t)mfile->offset >= mfile->size)
00139         nRemaining = 0;
00140     else
00141         nRemaining = mfile->size - mfile->offset;
00142     
00143     if (nCopy > nRemaining)
00144         nCopy = nRemaining;
00145     
00146     /* on EOF, return immediately and read (copy) nothing */
00147     if (nCopy <= 0)
00148         return (0);
00149 
00150     /* all set -> do the read (copy) */
00151     srcAddr = (void*)(&(mfile->mem[mfile->offset]));
00152     memcpy((void*)data, srcAddr, nCopy);
00153     mfile->offset += nCopy;     /* advance file ptr by copied bytes */
00154     return nCopy;
00155 }

00165 static tsize_t imb_tiff_WriteProc(thandle_t handle, tdata_t data, tsize_t n)
00166 {
00167     (void)handle;
00168     (void)data;
00169     (void)n;
00170     
00171     printf("imb_tiff_WriteProc: this function should not be called.\n");
00172     return (-1);
00173 }

00191 static toff_t imb_tiff_SeekProc(thandle_t handle, toff_t ofs, int whence)
00192 {
00193     ImbTIFFMemFile *mfile;
00194     toff_t new_offset;
00195 
00196     /* get the pointer to the in-memory file */
00197     mfile = IMB_TIFF_GET_MEMFILE(handle);
00198     if (!mfile || !mfile->mem) {
00199         fprintf(stderr, "imb_tiff_SeekProc: !mfile || !mfile->mem!\n");
00200         return (-1);
00201     }
00202 
00203     /* find the location we plan to seek to */
00204     switch (whence) {
00205         case SEEK_SET:
00206             new_offset = ofs;
00207             break;
00208         case SEEK_CUR:
00209             new_offset = mfile->offset + ofs;
00210             break;
00211         default:
00212             /* no other types are supported - return an error */
00213             fprintf(stderr, 
00214                 "imb_tiff_SeekProc: "
00215                 "Unsupported TIFF SEEK type.\n");
00216             return (-1);
00217     }
00218 
00219     /* set the new location */
00220     mfile->offset = new_offset;
00221     return mfile->offset;
00222 }

00238 static int imb_tiff_CloseProc(thandle_t handle)
00239 {
00240     ImbTIFFMemFile *mfile;
00241 
00242     /* get the pointer to the in-memory file */
00243     mfile = IMB_TIFF_GET_MEMFILE(handle);
00244     if (!mfile || !mfile->mem) {
00245         fprintf(stderr,"imb_tiff_CloseProc: !mfile || !mfile->mem!\n");
00246         return (0);
00247     }
00248     
00249     /* virtually close the file */
00250     mfile->mem    = NULL;
00251     mfile->offset = 0;
00252     mfile->size   = 0;
00253     
00254     return (0);
00255 }

00264 static toff_t imb_tiff_SizeProc(thandle_t handle)
00265 {
00266     ImbTIFFMemFile* mfile;
00267 
00268     /* get the pointer to the in-memory file */
00269     mfile = IMB_TIFF_GET_MEMFILE(handle);
00270     if (!mfile || !mfile->mem) {
00271         fprintf(stderr,"imb_tiff_SizeProc: !mfile || !mfile->mem!\n");
00272         return (0);
00273     }
00274 
00275     /* return the size */
00276     return (toff_t)(mfile->size);
00277 }

00279 static TIFF *imb_tiff_client_open(ImbTIFFMemFile *memFile, unsigned char *mem, size_t size)
00280 {
00281     /* open the TIFF client layer interface to the in-memory file */
00282     memFile->mem = mem;
00283     memFile->offset = 0;
00284     memFile->size = size;
00285 
00286     return TIFFClientOpen("(Blender TIFF Interface Layer)", 
00287         "r", (thandle_t)(memFile),
00288         imb_tiff_ReadProc, imb_tiff_WriteProc,
00289         imb_tiff_SeekProc, imb_tiff_CloseProc,
00290         imb_tiff_SizeProc, imb_tiff_DummyMapProc, imb_tiff_DummyUnmapProc);
00291 }

00308 #define IMB_TIFF_NCB 4      /* number of comparison bytes used */
00309 int imb_is_a_tiff(unsigned char *mem)
00310 {
00311     char big_endian[IMB_TIFF_NCB] = { 0x4d, 0x4d, 0x00, 0x2a };
00312     char lil_endian[IMB_TIFF_NCB] = { 0x49, 0x49, 0x2a, 0x00 };
00313 
00314     return ( (memcmp(big_endian, mem, IMB_TIFF_NCB) == 0) ||
00315          (memcmp(lil_endian, mem, IMB_TIFF_NCB) == 0) );
00316 }

00318 static void scanline_contig_16bit(float *rectf, unsigned short *sbuf, int scanline_w, int spp)
00319 {
00320     int i;
00321     for (i=0; i < scanline_w; i++) {
00322         rectf[i*4 + 0] = sbuf[i*spp + 0] / 65535.0;
00323         rectf[i*4 + 1] = sbuf[i*spp + 1] / 65535.0;
00324         rectf[i*4 + 2] = sbuf[i*spp + 2] / 65535.0;
00325         rectf[i*4 + 3] = (spp==4)?(sbuf[i*spp + 3] / 65535.0):1.0;
00326     }
00327 }
00328 
00329 static void scanline_contig_32bit(float *rectf, float *fbuf, int scanline_w, int spp)
00330 {
00331     int i;
00332     for (i=0; i < scanline_w; i++) {
00333         rectf[i*4 + 0] = fbuf[i*spp + 0];
00334         rectf[i*4 + 1] = fbuf[i*spp + 1];
00335         rectf[i*4 + 2] = fbuf[i*spp + 2];
00336         rectf[i*4 + 3] = (spp==4)?fbuf[i*spp + 3]:1.0f;
00337     }
00338 }
00339 
00340 static void scanline_separate_16bit(float *rectf, unsigned short *sbuf, int scanline_w, int chan)
00341 {
00342     int i;
00343     for (i=0; i < scanline_w; i++)
00344         rectf[i*4 + chan] = sbuf[i] / 65535.0;
00345 }
00346 
00347 static void scanline_separate_32bit(float *rectf, float *fbuf, int scanline_w, int chan)
00348 {
00349     int i;
00350     for (i=0; i < scanline_w; i++)
00351         rectf[i*4 + chan] = fbuf[i];
00352 }
00353 
00354 static void imb_read_tiff_resolution(ImBuf *ibuf, TIFF *image)
00355 {
00356     uint16 unit;
00357     float xres;
00358     float yres;
00359 
00360     TIFFGetFieldDefaulted(image, TIFFTAG_RESOLUTIONUNIT, &unit);
00361     TIFFGetFieldDefaulted(image, TIFFTAG_XRESOLUTION, &xres);
00362     TIFFGetFieldDefaulted(image, TIFFTAG_YRESOLUTION, &yres);
00363 
00364     if (unit == RESUNIT_CENTIMETER) {
00365         ibuf->ppm[0]= (double)xres * 100.0;
00366         ibuf->ppm[1]= (double)yres * 100.0;
00367     }
00368     else {
00369         ibuf->ppm[0]= (double)xres / 0.0254;
00370         ibuf->ppm[1]= (double)yres / 0.0254;
00371     }
00372 }
00373 
00374 /* 
00375  * Use the libTIFF scanline API to read a TIFF image.
00376  * This method is most flexible and can handle multiple different bit depths 
00377  * and RGB channel orderings.
00378  */
00379 static int imb_read_tiff_pixels(ImBuf *ibuf, TIFF *image, int premul)
00380 {
00381     ImBuf *tmpibuf;
00382     int success= 0;
00383     short bitspersample, spp, config;
00384     size_t scanline;
00385     int ib_flag=0, row, chan;
00386     float *fbuf=NULL;
00387     unsigned short *sbuf=NULL;
00388 
00389     TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_BITSPERSAMPLE, &bitspersample);
00390     TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_SAMPLESPERPIXEL, &spp);     /* number of 'channels' */
00391     TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_PLANARCONFIG, &config);
00392 
00393     imb_read_tiff_resolution(ibuf, image);
00394 
00395     scanline = TIFFScanlineSize(image);
00396     
00397     if (bitspersample == 32) {
00398         ib_flag = IB_rectfloat;
00399         fbuf = (float *)_TIFFmalloc(scanline);
00400     }
00401     else if (bitspersample == 16) {
00402         ib_flag = IB_rectfloat;
00403         sbuf = (unsigned short *)_TIFFmalloc(scanline);
00404     }
00405     else {
00406         ib_flag = IB_rect;
00407     }
00408     
00409     tmpibuf= IMB_allocImBuf(ibuf->x, ibuf->y, ibuf->planes, ib_flag);
00410     
00411     /* simple RGBA image */
00412     if (!(bitspersample == 32 || bitspersample == 16)) {
00413         success |= TIFFReadRGBAImage(image, ibuf->x, ibuf->y, tmpibuf->rect, 0);
00414     }
00415     /* contiguous channels: RGBRGBRGB */
00416     else if (config == PLANARCONFIG_CONTIG) {
00417         for (row = 0; row < ibuf->y; row++) {
00418             int ib_offset = ibuf->x*ibuf->y*4 - ibuf->x*4 * (row+1);
00419         
00420             if (bitspersample == 32) {
00421                 success |= TIFFReadScanline(image, fbuf, row, 0);
00422                 scanline_contig_32bit(tmpibuf->rect_float+ib_offset, fbuf, ibuf->x, spp);
00423                 
00424             }
00425             else if (bitspersample == 16) {
00426                 success |= TIFFReadScanline(image, sbuf, row, 0);
00427                 scanline_contig_16bit(tmpibuf->rect_float+ib_offset, sbuf, ibuf->x, spp);
00428             }
00429         }
00430     /* separate channels: RRRGGGBBB */
00431     }
00432     else if (config == PLANARCONFIG_SEPARATE) {
00433         
00434         /* imbufs always have 4 channels of data, so we iterate over all of them
00435          * but only fill in from the TIFF scanline where necessary. */
00436         for (chan = 0; chan < 4; chan++) {
00437             for (row = 0; row < ibuf->y; row++) {
00438                 int ib_offset = ibuf->x*ibuf->y*4 - ibuf->x*4 * (row+1);
00439                 
00440                 if (bitspersample == 32) {
00441                     if (chan == 3 && spp == 3) /* fill alpha if only RGB TIFF */
00442                         fill_vn_fl(fbuf, ibuf->x, 1.0f);
00443                     else
00444                         success |= TIFFReadScanline(image, fbuf, row, chan);
00445                     scanline_separate_32bit(tmpibuf->rect_float+ib_offset, fbuf, ibuf->x, chan);
00446                     
00447                 }
00448                 else if (bitspersample == 16) {
00449                     if (chan == 3 && spp == 3) /* fill alpha if only RGB TIFF */
00450                         fill_vn_ushort(sbuf, ibuf->x, 65535);
00451                     else
00452                         success |= TIFFReadScanline(image, sbuf, row, chan);
00453                     scanline_separate_16bit(tmpibuf->rect_float+ib_offset, sbuf, ibuf->x, chan);
00454                     
00455                 }
00456             }
00457         }
00458     }
00459     
00460     if (bitspersample == 32)
00461         _TIFFfree(fbuf);
00462     else if (bitspersample == 16)
00463         _TIFFfree(sbuf);
00464 
00465     if (success) {
00466         ibuf->profile = (bitspersample==32)?IB_PROFILE_LINEAR_RGB:IB_PROFILE_SRGB;
00467 
00468 //      Code seems to be not needed for 16 bits tif, on PPC G5 OSX (ton)
00469         if (bitspersample < 16)
00470             if (ENDIAN_ORDER == B_ENDIAN)
00471                 IMB_convert_rgba_to_abgr(tmpibuf);
00472         if (premul) {
00473             IMB_premultiply_alpha(tmpibuf);
00474             ibuf->flags |= IB_premul;
00475         }
00476         
00477         /* assign rect last */
00478         if (tmpibuf->rect_float)
00479             ibuf->rect_float= tmpibuf->rect_float;
00480         else    
00481             ibuf->rect= tmpibuf->rect;
00482         ibuf->mall |= ib_flag;
00483         ibuf->flags |= ib_flag;
00484         
00485         tmpibuf->mall &= ~ib_flag;
00486     }
00487 
00488     IMB_freeImBuf(tmpibuf);
00489     
00490     return success;
00491 }

00493 void imb_inittiff(void)
00494 {
00495     if (!(G.debug & G_DEBUG))
00496         TIFFSetErrorHandler(NULL);
00497 }
00498 
00510 ImBuf *imb_loadtiff(unsigned char *mem, size_t size, int flags)
00511 {
00512     TIFF *image = NULL;
00513     ImBuf *ibuf = NULL, *hbuf;
00514     ImbTIFFMemFile memFile;
00515     uint32 width, height;
00516     char *format = NULL;
00517     int level;
00518     short spp;
00519     int ib_depth;
00520 
00521     /* check whether or not we have a TIFF file */
00522     if (size < IMB_TIFF_NCB) {
00523         fprintf(stderr, "imb_loadtiff: size < IMB_TIFF_NCB\n");
00524         return NULL;
00525     }
00526     if (imb_is_a_tiff(mem) == 0)
00527         return NULL;
00528 
00529     image = imb_tiff_client_open(&memFile, mem, size);
00530 
00531     if (image == NULL) {
00532         printf("imb_loadtiff: could not open TIFF IO layer.\n");
00533         return NULL;
00534     }
00535 
00536     /* allocate the image buffer */
00537     TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_IMAGEWIDTH,  &width);
00538     TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_IMAGELENGTH, &height);
00539     TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_SAMPLESPERPIXEL, &spp);
00540     
00541     ib_depth = (spp==3)?24:32;
00542     
00543     ibuf = IMB_allocImBuf(width, height, ib_depth, 0);
00544     if (ibuf) {
00545         ibuf->ftype = TIF;
00546     }
00547     else {
00548         fprintf(stderr, 
00549             "imb_loadtiff: could not allocate memory for TIFF "
00550             "image.\n");
00551         TIFFClose(image);
00552         return NULL;
00553     }
00554 
00555     /* if testing, we're done */
00556     if (flags & IB_test) {
00557         TIFFClose(image);
00558         return ibuf;
00559     }
00560 
00561     /* detect if we are reading a tiled/mipmapped texture, in that case
00562      * we don't read pixels but leave it to the cache to load tiles */
00563     if (flags & IB_tilecache) {
00564         format= NULL;
00565         TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_PIXAR_TEXTUREFORMAT, &format);
00566 
00567         if (format && strcmp(format, "Plain Texture")==0 && TIFFIsTiled(image)) {
00568             int numlevel = TIFFNumberOfDirectories(image);
00569 
00570             /* create empty mipmap levels in advance */
00571             for (level=0; level<numlevel; level++) {
00572                 if (!TIFFSetDirectory(image, level))
00573                     break;
00574 
00575                 if (level > 0) {
00576                     width= (width > 1)? width/2: 1;
00577                     height= (height > 1)? height/2: 1;
00578 
00579                     hbuf= IMB_allocImBuf(width, height, 32, 0);
00580                     hbuf->miplevel= level;
00581                     hbuf->ftype= ibuf->ftype;
00582                     ibuf->mipmap[level-1] = hbuf;
00583 
00584                     if (flags & IB_premul)
00585                         hbuf->flags |= IB_premul;
00586                 }
00587                 else
00588                     hbuf= ibuf;
00589 
00590                 hbuf->flags |= IB_tilecache;
00591 
00592                 TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_TILEWIDTH, &hbuf->tilex);
00593                 TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_TILELENGTH, &hbuf->tiley);
00594 
00595                 hbuf->xtiles= ceil(hbuf->x/(float)hbuf->tilex);
00596                 hbuf->ytiles= ceil(hbuf->y/(float)hbuf->tiley);
00597 
00598                 imb_addtilesImBuf(hbuf);
00599 
00600                 ibuf->miptot++;
00601             }
00602         }
00603     }
00604 
00605     /* read pixels */
00606     if (!(ibuf->flags & IB_tilecache) && !imb_read_tiff_pixels(ibuf, image, 0)) {
00607         fprintf(stderr, "imb_loadtiff: Failed to read tiff image.\n");
00608         TIFFClose(image);
00609         return NULL;
00610     }
00611 
00612     /* close the client layer interface to the in-memory file */
00613     TIFFClose(image);
00614 
00615     /* return successfully */
00616     return ibuf;
00617 }
00618 
00619 void imb_loadtiletiff(ImBuf *ibuf, unsigned char *mem, size_t size, int tx, int ty, unsigned int *rect)
00620 {
00621     TIFF *image = NULL;
00622     uint32 width, height;
00623     ImbTIFFMemFile memFile;
00624 
00625     image = imb_tiff_client_open(&memFile, mem, size);
00626 
00627     if (image == NULL) {
00628         printf("imb_loadtiff: could not open TIFF IO layer for loading mipmap level.\n");
00629         return;
00630     }
00631 
00632     if (TIFFSetDirectory(image, ibuf->miplevel)) { /* allocate the image buffer */
00633         TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_IMAGEWIDTH,  &width);
00634         TIFFGetField(image, TIFFTAG_IMAGELENGTH, &height);
00635 
00636         if (width == ibuf->x && height == ibuf->y) {
00637             if (rect) {
00638                 /* tiff pixels are bottom to top, tiles are top to bottom */
00639                 if (TIFFReadRGBATile(image, tx*ibuf->tilex, (ibuf->ytiles - 1 - ty)*ibuf->tiley, rect) == 1) {
00640                     if (ibuf->tiley > ibuf->y)
00641                         memmove(rect, rect+ibuf->tilex*(ibuf->tiley - ibuf->y), sizeof(int)*ibuf->tilex*ibuf->y);
00642 
00643                     if (ibuf->flags & IB_premul)
00644                         IMB_premultiply_rect(rect, 32, ibuf->tilex, ibuf->tiley);
00645                 }
00646                 else
00647                     printf("imb_loadtiff: failed to read tiff tile at mipmap level %d\n", ibuf->miplevel);
00648             }
00649         }
00650         else
00651             printf("imb_loadtiff: mipmap level %d has unexpected size %ux%u instead of %dx%d\n", ibuf->miplevel, width, height, ibuf->x, ibuf->y);
00652     }
00653     else
00654         printf("imb_loadtiff: could not find mipmap level %d\n", ibuf->miplevel);
00655 
00656     /* close the client layer interface to the in-memory file */
00657     TIFFClose(image);
00658 }
00659 
00676 int imb_savetiff(ImBuf *ibuf, const char *name, int flags)
00677 {
00678     TIFF *image = NULL;
00679     uint16 samplesperpixel, bitspersample;
00680     size_t npixels;
00681     unsigned char *pixels = NULL;
00682     unsigned char *from = NULL, *to = NULL;
00683     unsigned short *pixels16 = NULL, *to16 = NULL;
00684     float *fromf = NULL;
00685     float xres, yres;
00686     int x, y, from_i, to_i, i;
00687     int extraSampleTypes[1] = { EXTRASAMPLE_ASSOCALPHA };
00688     
00689 
00690     /* check for a valid number of bytes per pixel.  Like the PNG writer,
00691      * the TIFF writer supports 1, 3 or 4 bytes per pixel, corresponding
00692      * to gray, RGB, RGBA respectively. */
00693     samplesperpixel = (uint16)((ibuf->planes + 7) >> 3);
00694     if ((samplesperpixel > 4) || (samplesperpixel == 2)) {
00695         fprintf(stderr,
00696             "imb_savetiff: unsupported number of bytes per " 
00697             "pixel: %d\n", samplesperpixel);
00698         return (0);
00699     }
00700 
00701     if ((ibuf->ftype & TIF_16BIT) && ibuf->rect_float)
00702         bitspersample = 16;
00703     else
00704         bitspersample = 8;
00705 
00706     /* open TIFF file for writing */
00707     if (flags & IB_mem) {
00708         /* bork at the creation of a TIFF in memory */
00709         fprintf(stderr,
00710             "imb_savetiff: creation of in-memory TIFF files is " 
00711             "not yet supported.\n");
00712         return (0);
00713     }
00714     else {
00715         /* create image as a file */
00716         image = TIFFOpen(name, "w");
00717     }
00718     if (image == NULL) {
00719         fprintf(stderr,
00720             "imb_savetiff: could not open TIFF for writing.\n");
00721         return (0);
00722     }
00723 
00724     /* allocate array for pixel data */
00725     npixels = ibuf->x * ibuf->y;
00726     if (bitspersample == 16)
00727         pixels16 = (unsigned short*)_TIFFmalloc(npixels *
00728             samplesperpixel * sizeof(unsigned short));
00729     else
00730         pixels = (unsigned char*)_TIFFmalloc(npixels *
00731             samplesperpixel * sizeof(unsigned char));
00732 
00733     if (pixels == NULL && pixels16 == NULL) {
00734         fprintf(stderr,
00735             "imb_savetiff: could not allocate pixels array.\n");
00736         TIFFClose(image);
00737         return (0);
00738     }
00739 
00740     /* setup pointers */
00741     if (bitspersample == 16) {
00742         fromf = ibuf->rect_float;
00743         to16   = pixels16;
00744     }
00745     else {
00746         from = (unsigned char*)ibuf->rect;
00747         to   = pixels;
00748     }
00749 
00750     /* setup samples per pixel */
00751     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_BITSPERSAMPLE, bitspersample);
00752     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_SAMPLESPERPIXEL, samplesperpixel);
00753 
00754     if (samplesperpixel == 4) {
00755         /* RGBA images */
00756         TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_EXTRASAMPLES, 1,
00757                 extraSampleTypes);
00758         TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_PHOTOMETRIC, 
00759                 PHOTOMETRIC_RGB);
00760     }
00761     else if (samplesperpixel == 3) {
00762         /* RGB images */
00763         TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_PHOTOMETRIC,
00764                 PHOTOMETRIC_RGB);
00765     }
00766     else if (samplesperpixel == 1) {
00767         /* greyscale images, 1 channel */
00768         TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_PHOTOMETRIC,
00769                 PHOTOMETRIC_MINISBLACK);
00770     }
00771 
00772     /* copy pixel data.  While copying, we flip the image vertically. */
00773     for (x = 0; x < ibuf->x; x++) {
00774         for (y = 0; y < ibuf->y; y++) {
00775             from_i = 4*(y*ibuf->x+x);
00776             to_i   = samplesperpixel*((ibuf->y-y-1)*ibuf->x+x);
00777 
00778             if (pixels16) {
00779                 /* convert from float source */
00780                 float rgb[3];
00781                 
00782                 if (ibuf->profile == IB_PROFILE_LINEAR_RGB)
00783                     linearrgb_to_srgb_v3_v3(rgb, &fromf[from_i]);
00784                 else
00785                     copy_v3_v3(rgb, &fromf[from_i]);
00786 
00787                 to16[to_i+0] = FTOUSHORT(rgb[0]);
00788                 to16[to_i+1] = FTOUSHORT(rgb[1]);
00789                 to16[to_i+2] = FTOUSHORT(rgb[2]);
00790                 to_i += 3; from_i+=3;
00791                 
00792                 if (samplesperpixel == 4) {
00793                     to16[to_i+3] = FTOUSHORT(fromf[from_i+3]);
00794                     /*to_i++; from_i++;*/ /*unused, set on each loop */
00795                 }
00796             }
00797             else {
00798                 for (i = 0; i < samplesperpixel; i++, to_i++, from_i++)
00799                     to[to_i] = from[from_i];
00800             }
00801         }
00802     }
00803 
00804     /* write the actual TIFF file */
00805     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_IMAGEWIDTH,      ibuf->x);
00806     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_IMAGELENGTH,     ibuf->y);
00807     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_ROWSPERSTRIP,    ibuf->y);
00808     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_COMPRESSION, COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
00809     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_FILLORDER, FILLORDER_MSB2LSB);
00810     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_PLANARCONFIG, PLANARCONFIG_CONTIG);
00811 
00812 
00813     if (ibuf->ppm[0] > 0.0 && ibuf->ppm[1] > 0.0) {
00814         xres= (float)(ibuf->ppm[0] * 0.0254);
00815         yres= (float)(ibuf->ppm[1] * 0.0254);
00816     }
00817     else {
00818         xres= yres= 150.0f;
00819     }
00820 
00821     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_XRESOLUTION,     xres);
00822     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_YRESOLUTION,     yres);
00823     TIFFSetField(image, TIFFTAG_RESOLUTIONUNIT,  RESUNIT_INCH);
00824     if (TIFFWriteEncodedStrip(image, 0,
00825             (bitspersample == 16)? (unsigned char*)pixels16: pixels,
00826             ibuf->x*ibuf->y*samplesperpixel*bitspersample/8) == -1) {
00827         fprintf(stderr,
00828             "imb_savetiff: Could not write encoded TIFF.\n");
00829         TIFFClose(image);
00830         if (pixels) _TIFFfree(pixels);
00831         if (pixels16) _TIFFfree(pixels16);
00832         return (1);
00833     }
00834 
00835     /* close the TIFF file */
00836     TIFFClose(image);
00837     if (pixels) _TIFFfree(pixels);
00838     if (pixels16) _TIFFfree(pixels16);
00839     return (1);
00840 }
Generated on Tue Nov 13 2012 11:54:59 for Blender by  doxygen 1.7.4
